item.title: EDEN.schemata(); delayed to 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

No longer due out this winter.

Publisher PLAYISM will developers illuCalab. and WSS playground-have delayed science-fiction mystery adventure game EDEN.schemata(); from its previously planned winter release window to 2026. It will be available for PC via Steam with English, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese language support.

Here is the full message from the developers on the delay:

We had originally planned to release EDEN.schemata(); this winter.

However, in order to further refine one of the game’s cores “narrative and gameplay flow that changes based on the player’s actions,” we have decided to adjust the release window to a planned launch of 2026.

We sincerely apologize to everyone who has been looking forward to the game.

The development team is working with the utmost dedication to deliver an even better experience.

A Letter from the Developers

To everyone who has been waiting for this game, we are truly sorry.

The release date has been moved to “2026.” We apologize for keeping you waiting yet again. The support we’ve received, from the excitement voiced across various communities to the feedback from players who tried the demo at events, has been a tremendous source of encouragement for our team. We are deeply grateful.

This project involves implementing an unusual system into the game. We believe this system will make the experience truly one-of-a-kind, but such an ambitious approach also presents significant challenges.

There were moments when we wondered if perhaps creating a game like this was too early for us—or even for humanity—but after much trial and error, the final vision is gradually taking shape. Because we want to present the game at its best, we kindly ask for a little more time.

Additionally, because of how the game plays, the user interface, and story all change based on the player’s actions. Which means even sharing small bits of information becomes potential spoilers. This has made it difficult to communicate ongoing progress through social media, even though development is continuing steadily each day under director EIKI.

We are eagerly looking forward to the day when we can share this game with all of you, and we hope you will look forward to it as well. Your patience would mean the world to us.

Thank you once again for your continued support of EDEN.schemata();.

item.title: Occult horror visual novel Resequence: The Orchard announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
CLEAR RAVE has announced Resequence: The Orchard, an occult horror visual novel coming to PC via Steam in 2026. It will support English, Japanese, and Simplified Chinese language options, with other languages to possibly be added later.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

An occult horror adventure lurking beyond the case file.

Resequence: The Orchard is a multi-perspective occult-horror adventure game about an otherworldly presence slowly eroding everyday life, featuring unsettling visuals by fracoco and a story by Re,AER.

Players would play the role of Kisuke Saito and uncover the students’ past by hearing their experiences. Reveal the truth of his wife’s missing and eventually bring out what lies beneath the record—what’s haunted “there.”

Story

Feeling extremely hard to move on after his wife’s missing and drained of the will to live, Kisuke Saito—encouraged by his colleague Aislinn and a high school girl Kaneko Honda—accepted the job as a school counselor. But every student who comes to him is plagued by inexplicable phenomena…

Key Features

  • A visual novel focused on the story.
  • The story continues through mouse clicks and dialogue choices.
  • More than five characters and each with standing portraits.
  • Different stories based on your selections.

item.title: Yunyun Syndrome!? Rhythm Psychosis delayed to April 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Rhythm adventure game demo available now.

Publisher and developer WSS playground, publisher Alliance Arts, and developer WHO YOU have delayed rhythm adventure game Yunyun Syndrome!? Rhythm Psychosis from its previously planned winter release window to April 2026. It will be available for PC via Steam. A demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Yunyun Syndrome!? Rhythm Psychosis is a rhythm adventure game about a psychotic hikikomori girl—also an avid anonymous poster—who corrupts the world with her severe brain rot from listening to too many denpa songs. Yunyun all over this ♡♡♡♡ world with your degen otaku-posting.

High and vibin’ with denpa songs, we’ll corrupt the entire Internet! Hehe. all we need is a bit of otaku love, that’s all.

This is a rhythm-adventure game where you play as a hikikomori (shut-in) girl who’s high on denpa songs. Become Yunyun-brained and lose all self-control to anonymously post on social media and destroy the world with your Yunyun brain rot.

Have a Doki-Doki experience with over 30 denpa songs and multiple endings.
  • Q. Why did she become a hikikomori?
  • Q. How does anonymous online posting lead to world destruction?
  • Q. Does a happy ending exist for a degenerate otaku?

The answers to those “Q’s” lie at the convergence of insanity and denpa psychosis. Now, put those headphones on and become ill with Yunyun Syndrome!? Rhythm Psychosis.

Groove to the DENPA!

  • Anonymously Post Online and Infect the Whole World with Yunyun-Brain! – Get high on denpa songs and sink in the depths of social media!! Browse social media at the start of the song to check up on your Yunyun cult and haters. And then prepare for the climax where you can start dropping posts left and right. Successfully posting will cause other social media users to become psychotically Yunyun-ified. Social media is all about sharing—spread your heartful psychosis to everyone else!

Characters

  • Qtie – The main character. A hikikomori. She suffered too much irl that she’s become a little (very) fuzzy in the head. Her obsessive love for the fictional character “Yunyun” is for sure an illness. Her overly “high” state from overdosing denpa songs causes her to propagate Yunyun love. Will there really be a happy end for such a degenerate otaku?
  • Yunyun – A fictional character that loves Qtie. A very much angelic devil. She will speak to Qtie through the monitor screen. Whilst the truth is unknown, most likely, she is just a figment of Qtie’s imagination. It’s joever for her.

About Denpa Songs!

“Denpa” is a genre of music that is intentionally strange and catchy. All playable songs in this game are denpa songs. Many popular denpa songs such as “it’s a cherry kissing explosion” (Sakuranbo Kiss) and many more are featured!

item.title: Into the Fire launches in Early Access in 2026
item.content:encoded:
Cataclysm extraction survival game Into the Fire will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam and GOG in 2026, developer Starward Industries announced. A playtest is coming “soon.”

Here is an overview of the game, via Starward Industries:

About

Set out on a dark adventure in the shadow of an erupting volcano. Rescue people and animals while battling the wrath of nature and the spirits of fire in Into the Fire, a cataclysm extraction survival set in a dangerous world shaken by natural disaster.

Survive and Rescue Others

You are a bold explorer struggling to survive during a volcanic eruption on Dante’s Archipelago. With the world collapsing around you, you must rescue as many lives as possible through lava and ash. Navigate crumbling landscapes, outrun firestorms, and unearth secrets buried deep in the volcanic abyss—facing its demons and an onslaught of ever-shifting threats and strange anomalies that fuel the chaos.

  • High-stakes rescue missions.
  • Navigate dynamic, collapsing landscapes.
  • Face supernatural threats and anomalies.

Fight With Supernatural Phenomena

Armed with unconventional weapons and tools—fire-extinguishing shotguns, seismic scanners, and retro inventions—you must race against time to save lives while unraveling fiery myths, confronting enigmatic forces of nature, and uncovering dark rituals lurking within the inferno.

  • Unique firefighting weapons and gadgets.
  • Battle mythic volcanic demons & strange phenomena.
  • Tactical extinguishing combat.
  • Race against time in a volatile environment.

Take Care of Your Hub

The Hub will be your sanctuary—a place to regroup, craft essential survival tools, upgrade gear, rest in a garden, choose the equipment that determines your playstyle and piece together the island’s ominous past. Beyond its walls, something terrifying is waiting.

  • Central base for crafting and upgrades.
  • Customize gear and playstyle.
  • Rest and recover.
  • Uncover deep island lore.

Dive Into the Retro Aesthetic

The game’s world pulses with a distinct retro aesthetic, capturing the golden age of scientific ambition intertwined with folklore and the supernatural – offering a survival experience that leaves you breathless with every burning step.

  • Retro visual design.
  • Blend of science, folklore & supernatural.
  • Atmospheric, immersive world-building.
  • Unique art style inspired by classic science-fiction.
For Action SeekersFor Survival EnthusiastsFor Emotion Lovers
Combat volcanic fire and mystical demonsExplore ruins in a post-apo atmosphereUncover mythical secrets and relics
Become a catastrophic responderLocate survivors amidst wastelandsFace moral dilemmas, choose who to save
Face disastrous, deadly environmentUpgrade gear and your operation baseDiscover stories of those who survived
Use tactical, retro extinguishing weaponsCraft and enhance fantastical retro gadgetsHelp locals by completing their quests
Use unique traversal tools & vehiclesStrategically manage scarce resourcesTend to rescued plants and animals

Blending extinguisher shooter action, survival, gripping tales, and psychological depth, Into the Fire delivers an intense, genre-bending experience. You’ll be immersed in a hypnotic vision where science meets mysticism, pushing you to cross the gates of hell and save just one more life.

item.title: Flotsam launches December 5
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Floating city builder leaving Early Access after six years.

Floating city builder Flotsam will leave Early Access and launch for PC via Steam and GOG on December 5, Stray Fawn Publishing and developer Pajama Llama Games announced.

Flotsam first launched in Early Access on September 26, 2019.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Sail, scavenge, and rescue survivors in a vibrant floating city-builder. Captain your drifters across the endless garbage sea to uncover soaked ruins, rusting factories, and stories from the old world.

Build Your Floating Home

Turn ocean garbage into homes, workshops and colorful little gardens.

  • Collect floating plastic and driftwood, salvage scraps of the old world, and recycle them into homes that stay afloat.
  • Desalinate water, gut fish and board up a shelter to keep everyone safe.
  • Decorate your town with plants, refurbished furniture and statues that keep your drifters happy.

Travel the Sea With Your Town

Set sail to explore the flooded world, from soaked ruins to forgotten islands, and discover what still floats beyond the horizon.

  • Explore flooded remnants of the old world.
  • Rescue stranded survivors and friendly animals.
  • Re-discover old technology to improve your town. But be careful your drifters don’t get sick. The old world is polluted!

Meet Unique Drifters and Specialists

Your drifters each have their own stories to tell. Recruit specialists who unlock new buildings, quests, and discoveries for your floating community.

  • Find unique drifters like the Birdkeeper, Chemist, and Electrician.
  • Unlock new technologies and story quests through their expertise.
  • Complete personal storylines to unlock new mechanics.

Recycle, Research, and Reinvent

Develop cleaner, smarter systems that turn waste into progress and keep your floating town thriving in this feel-good apocalypse.

  • Research new tech to transition from burning firewood to green eel-ectricity generation.
  • Build connected production pipelines that turn your floating town into a self-sustaining ecosystem.
  • Clean food and develop cures for pollution-born diseases and keep your drifters healthy and productive.

Watch a new trailer below.

item.title: Dead Format launches December 10
item.content:encoded:
• PC

VHS survival horror game dated.

Survival horror game Dead Format will launch for PC via Steam on December 10, publisher Oro Interactive and developer Katanalevy announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

A lost brother. A cursed VHS format. A government cover-up.

Dead Format is a survival horror game that takes you on a nightmarish journey through iconic eras of film. Set in 1990s Scotland, you play as a desperate sibling searching for their missing brother who was last seen obsessing over a mysterious VHS format. Dive into the tapes, fight your way through cinematic worlds, and find your brother before it’s too late.

Survive the Cursed Tapes

Your apartment is the hub. Here you can review clues, catch your breath, and prepare for the journey ahead. Use the Television set and insert VHS tapes to open the door to new worlds, each one with its own inspiration. Search for clues and face the nightmares in universes inspired by Silent Era Cinema, Italian Giallo films, 80s Body Horror, Found Footage and more.

Key Features

  • Scavenge and Solve – Search for supplies to stay alive and uncover key items to solve puzzles, unlocking your path forward.
  • Unusual Arsenal – Arm yourself with weapons and tools inspired by the film worlds you’ll explore.
  • Live-Action Video – Discover eerie VHS footage that blurs the line between fiction and reality.
  • Classic Survival Design – Your apartment is the only place you can save the game. Find shortcuts and new paths to progress on your journey.
  • Survive Twisted Worlds – Each world comes with its own enemies, puzzles, and bosses to defeat.

Banned for a Reason

Watching these tapes is dangerous. Some things aren’t meant to be recorded… and now, they’re watching you back.

item.title: TSURUGIHIME launches in Early Access in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Side-scrolling action RPG gets a release window.

Side-scrolling action RPG TSURUGIHIME will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam in 2026, developer Fahrenheit 213 announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Fahrenheit 213:

About

In 100 days, the decisive battle will come.

How you spend every day until then is entirely up to you.

TSURUGIHIME is a side scrolling action RPG inspired by timeless classics, where you can craft every aspect of your adventure—combat, growth, exploration, story, and even your “little sister.”

It is an RPG that lets you shape not only your journey, but destiny itself.

Character design is handled by KUROBOSHI KOUHAKU, known for his work on Summon Night, Kino’s Journey, and Sword Art Online Alternative: Gun Gale Online.

The composer is Takeharu Ishimoto, whose notable works include The World Ends with You, Kingdom Hearts, and Crisis Core: Final Fantasy VII.

Directed by Yosuke Shiokawa, who previously served as creative producer on Fate/Grand Order, TSURUGIHIME marks his first game since going independent. A small, tightly knit team is bringing the project to life, pouring their passion and craftsmanship into every aspect of the experience.

  • ❮
  • ❯

A 100-Day Story Where Your Choices Shape Your Destiny

There are 100 days left until the decisive battle, and each day is yours to decide. Grind through encounters to build your strength, challenge a formidable enemy on a whim, or step away from the fighting and just let time drift by. Your decisions carve out the protagonist’s destiny. Discover your own ideal rhythm for each day and craft the route that leads you to victory.

A Day-by-Day Journey Shaped by Your Decisions

Within the limited span of 100 days, players must constantly decide their next best move. At times, you may take on risky negotiations or choose a harder path despite the dangers. Each day presents challenges both great and small, testing how effectively you can make that day count. Your decisions carve out the protagonist’s fate. As the situation shifts with every move, find your own next step—and craft the best day you can.

The Power of the Tsurugi—A Blade Capable of Rewriting Fate Itself

As the protagonist’s signature ability, the player can wield the power of the Tsurugi to rewrite fate itself. With this power, you can transform items you’ve obtained into entirely different ones, erase enemies before you as if they never existed, and even rewind time by rolling back the days that have already passed. It is, in every sense, a truly game-breaking force. This ace in your hand can shatter the destiny laid out for the protagonist. Within the 100 day constraint, wield this fate bending power and craft a future that is uniquely your own.

item.title: Story-driven adventure game All Adrift announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
About

Face the history laid upon the operating table, and the countenance of humanity.

Drift atop the records of sin humanity has left behind, and answer for the meaning of existence and salvation.

Whether in darkness or in light, walk upon the edge of humankind’s end, and bare your most human self.

All Adrift is an aesthetic epic on a cosmic scale—a fusion of literary text, painterly visuals, and the interplay of classical and modern music.

The player becomes Sian Lightchaser—a survivor of an immortal, cursed race, captured by the Arwin Empire and forced to perform surgery on the history of the universe.

She is imprisoned in the role of a Sacred Author, tasked with creating a religion to glorify Arwin’s eternal authority and the deification of its ruling class.
Sian drifts through a cosmos where the ending war has dragged on for four centuries beyond the armistice, repainting the history of the universe as both victim and collaborator.

This work is a narrative-driven simulation adventure that explores the irony of guilt and survival through Sian—dispatched across multiple universes to create “Arwinism” for those who massacred her own people, and compelled to confront the unfathomable vastness and histories of the cosmos as she operates on the past and present of planets.

It is not merely a “game to be played,” but a “philosophical opera” that asks how humanity survives within the indelible memory of its own sins.

…

Sian sits in the carriage, gazing out the window. A beautiful flash of gold spreads like a fracture, cracking through the white clouds, as if to swallow the entire sky, then fades. Arwin Type 38; perhaps the light shed by that terminal technology as it swept across yet another helpless galaxy. She envisions the histories erased by that fleeting light. Are those the scars of human sin, or the creases of a world fading away? Either could be true. In an age where humane reflection itself has turned into an odd taste, she plays, if only briefly, the role of an oddity.

Sian still sits in the carriage, gazing out the window. Among the guides busily selling death, one rushes toward the carriage with the vigor of a market peddler, reminding her that this planet she has just arrived on is experimenting with the entertainment of death.

The Most Ecstatic Deaths: Best Selection

That ironic title is brazenly stitched in bright thread across the cover the guide thrusts at her window—beside an illustration of the dead, smiling faintly as they lie in ordered rows. The headless coachman gestured threateningly for him to leave. The guide’s eyes, having found no head to glare at, briefly wandered the coachman’s body—until they caught the emblem of Arwin. The moment they did, his eyes dropped, as if to escape a gaze that does not exist.

In front of all this fuss, Sian sits in the carriage, gazing out the window. Her focus drifts indifferently to the billboard above the road.

Casualties Today: 91,060,000,080

Four hundred years of ceasefire, held in the name of peace negotiations—and despite centuries of propaganda declaring that “the war is ending,” countless lives still vanish each day, leaving nothing behind, consumed as numbers wielded by those who are unaccountable. Just a numbers game. An endless numbers game. A goddamn huge numbers game. As Sian stares at the board, trying to count the numbers that must have vanished during the long truce, when a sudden voice bursts from the carriage speaker, the fervent cry of the propaganda hour.

“History is written in Arwin’s handwriting!”

Lies.

“Our noble honor is born from devotion to the Empire…”

Noble lies.

“The great Arwinian does not fear death—death fears the Arwinian!”

Great, filthy lies.

“Entrust your future to the Empire!”

That one’s honest.

In this world that can reach every star, whose freedom stretches long only to narrow into a cage, Sian listens to the propaganda echoing through the carriage and thinks.

Is even this not enough? After obliterating all those peoples, after wiping out all those planets, after rendering all those lives less than mere numbers, is there still something left that must be carved away, resurrecting even this forbidden technology of cosmic surgery?

She looks at the cursed surgical instrument in her hand, the tool that can turn every life beyond the window into something less than a number. The weight of karma crushes her, suffocating every thought and feeling. Tomorrow’s throat lies in her hand. And now, it is her turn to wield it.

Surely, there is no god in such a cruel world. Certainly not. Even if there were, it would not be one from which we could hope for salvation. But that was the story up to now. What of tomorrow? At the heart of Arwin’s capital, a tower white enough to be black coils like a serpent, coveting the seat of a godless world as it creeps darkly toward tomorrow.

Above all these stories, Sian sits imprisoned in the carriage. For a while yet, she will remain so.

Ribbit!

Staff

  • Producer, Director, Writer, Game Design Director, Art Director, Music Producer: Bae Sang Hyun
  • Game Designer, Programmer: Woo Gi Hun
  • Composer: Park Na Hyun
  • Voice Cast: Mare Flos, Bae Sang Hyun, Kim Han Baek
  • Trailer Voice: Kim Sin Woo

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: ‘Life-intervention type watch-over game’ Haunted Room! Urami-chan launches in 2026
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Travel back and forth between the present and the past of a room in an apartment.

“Life-intervention type watch-over game” Haunted Room! Urami-chan will launch for PC via Steam in 2026, developer Minimum Box announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Minimum Box:

About

Urami-chan is a “life-intervention type watch-over game” in which the player controls the earthbound spirit Urami-chan and travels back and forth between the present and the past of a room in an apartment building while trying to change the future of the murdered room’s residents. The game progresses in semi-real time, and players intervene while watching over the actions of the residents.

Story

December 31, 1988. Due to the murder of a resident “Ms. Noroi” in one of her apartment rooms, the apartment was in danger of being demolished.

It was a story that was no stranger to “Urami-chan,” the earthbound spirit in her room. Jishibei spirits disappear when they no longer have a place to call their own. With the advice of the human spirit “Onebii,” she returned to the past and took action to change Noroi’s future.

How to Play

One month from the time Ms. Noroi moved in until she was murdered. The player returns to the past from the calendar of the room where the murder took place and intervenes in Ms. Noroi’s life for three hours until the resident, Ms. Noroi, returns home and goes to bed, to make her presence known.

What Urami-chan Can Do

  • Call
  • Telekinesis

After three hours, the player returns to the original time, and if something changes, the date to return is updated. By using telekinesis to cause small “anomalies” at first, the past is gradually changed.

The number of “anomalies” that can be triggered will increase as the player gains experience by surprising Ms. Noroi. If you can make a big change in the past, might you be able to change your own future?

Watch the debut trailer below.

item.content:encoded:
• PC

Visual novel RPG due out in 2026.

Publisher G-MODE Corporation and developer Acacia have released the debut trailer for visual novel RPG Haishin Shoujo no Uraaka Meikyuu.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Trapped in a maze of secret alt accounts—you wanna escape?

The owner of the alt is waiting for you somewhere within: find them and kill them.

Story

The all-girl band Rag Drops is breaking out on social media with the vocalist of the century, Neon, taking the lead. But then ████████████. ██████████, “████” ███████████. Rag Drops is accused of heinous crimes.

“████████, it’s your fault.”

The band is engulfed in an unprecedented firestorm. ███████—? Suspicion and doubt begin eating them alive when suddenly their smartphones begin to glow.

Welcome to the otherworld UraU, girls, where the dark side of social media materializes!

What’s Up, Chat! Like People, This Game is Two-faced!

  • Side 1: Dungeon Exploration – If you wanna escape the manifestation of this secret alt account, you gotta survive the dungeon U. Slaughter malicious monsters infesting the alt and hunt down the Secret Alt’s Owner waiting in the dungeon depths❤
  • Side 2: Twisty Adventure Sections Chock Full of Secrets – The malicious dungeon belongs to one of the girls. Whose could it be…? Speculate wildly and give the guilty girl a public execution!

Let’s watch the poor helpless girls, ‘kay…?

    • Obsession: ███
    • Secret Alt: ███
    • Hashtags: #███ #███ #███
  • Psyche Riiru (voiced by Kana Hoshizaki) – “I write a suicide note every day!”” A bright, vivacious girl fascinated with suicide. She has a strange idea of “”personal space”” and is happiest when others rely on her. She finds being needed comforting. Her childhood friends are Hino Neon and Ichinose Kairi.

item.title: Danganronpa 2×2 – six minutes of ‘Special Trial Version’ gameplay
item.content:encoded:

  • PS5
  • Switch

  • Xbox Series

New footage from stage event at Danganronpa 15th Anniversary Fes.

Spike Chunsoft premiered six minutes of gameplay from the Danganronpa 2×2 demo playable at today’s Danganronpa 15th Anniversary Fes: Ultimate Appreciation Festival during the Danganronpa 2×2 Special Stage event.

Here is an overview of the game, via Spike Chunsoft:

About

Jabberwock Island—once a popular tourist destination, this now uninhabited island remains oddly pristine. You and your classmates at Hope’s Peak Academy have been brought to this island for a school trip. However, the fun time in the sun ends abruptly as Monokuma returns with his murderous scheme. Trapped on this island of mutual killing, your only hope of escape rests in solving the island’s mysteries. But be warned—sometimes the truth can be its own despair…

This latest installment features an all-new storyline built on the foundation of Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair. The original setting and cast of characters are back, but a single incident leads to an entirely new set of victims, culprits, and tricks. The new scenario offers the same volume of content as the original, delivering a complete and immersive experience.

Also included is the original Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair scenario, adapted to modern platforms with updated visuals and refined presentation. Enjoy the thrilling story with beautiful new graphics and quality-of-life improvements!

Find the Blackened of the murder case by gathering testimonies and evidence. During the Class Trial where you engage in a debate with your fellow classmates, shoot down your opponent’s contradictions with high-speed detective action. Enjoy the trials fully voiced by renowned actors!

The story unfolds in chapters and each is divided into three main parts:

  • Daily Life – Explore Jabberwock Island by walking around freely and interacting with the Ultimate Students. When a murder occurs and a body is discovered, an investigation begins.
  • Investigation – You’ll examine the crime scene, talk to other Ultimate Students, and collect evidence needed to solve the case. The evidence you find becomes Truth Bullets for rebutting your classmates’ contradictory statements. Collecting all clues lets you advance to the Class Trial.
  • Class Trial – Use the evidence you’ve gathered to find the Blackened—the murder culprit—in the Class Trial. The Ultimate Students will use their unique talents to debate the case from different angles. As statements flow across the screen, shoot down the contradictions with True Bullets to counter them and continue with the trial. Reach the truth of the case through nonstop, high-speed debate!

Danganronpa 2×2 is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam in 2026.
